hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Failed Support Break with Volume
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC breaks below key support level (previous 20-day low) on volume > 50% above 20-day average AND the break holds for 2 consecutive closes, transition to BEAR regime occurs within 3 days with 68% probability, generating short opportunities with -7% expected returns over next 8 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volume-confirmed breakdowns of established support during neutral periods indicate distribution and changing market structure. Consecutive closes confirm validity of break. Negative exchange flows suggest institutional/professional selling rather than retail stop-loss runs.
entry_conditions: BTC closes below previous 20-day low (support level)
Volume on break day > 50% above 20-day average volume
Break holds for 2 consecutive closes below support
Cumulative exchange netflow turns negative (> $100M outflow) over 3 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 9% BTC decline from entry OR regime transitions to BEAR
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims and closes above broken support level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If breakdown leads to BULL regime > 30% of time (false breakdown), OR if mean 8-day returns are > -2% (weak follow-through).
